data.chText: 紧握
data.enText: holding tightly

data.chText: 紧握；紧抓
data.enText: an act of holding sb/sth tightly; a particular way of doing this

data.chText: 紧紧抓住绳索不放。
data.enText: Keep a tight grip on the rope.

data.chText: 松手
data.enText: to loosen/release/relax your grip

data.chText: 她尽力抓住那冰冷的石头。
data.enText: She tried to get a grip on the icy rock.

data.chText: 登山女子滑了一下松开了手。
data.enText: The climber slipped and lost her grip .

data.chText: 他紧拉住她不放，她奋力挣脱。
data.enText: She struggled from his grip.

data.chText: 试着调整一下你握球拍的方法。
data.enText: Try adjusting your grip on the racket.

data.chText: 控制力；影响力
data.enText: control/power

data.chText: （对…的）控制，影响力
data.enText: control or power over sb/sth

data.chText: 主队牢牢控制着比赛的局面。
data.enText: The home team took a firm grip on the game.

data.chText: 我们得加强对市场的控制力。
data.enText: We need to tighten the grip we have on the market.

data.chText: 理解
data.enText: understanding

data.chText: 理解；了解
data.enText: an understanding of sth

data.chText: 我无法理解正在发生的事情。
data.enText: I couldn't get a grip on what was going on.

data.chText: 做这个工作你需要充分了解实际情况。
data.enText: You need to keep a good grip on reality in this job.

data.chText: 不打滑
data.enText: moving without slipping

data.chText: 不打滑；走得稳
data.enText: the ability of sth to move over a surface without slipping

data.chText: 这些轮胎可使公共汽车在路滑时行驶得平稳一些。
data.enText: These tyres give the bus better grip in slippery conditions.

data.chText: 物体部位
data.enText: part of object

data.chText: 把手；手柄；握杆
data.enText: a part of sth that has a special surface so that it can be held without the hands slipping

data.chText: 高尔夫球杆的握柄
data.enText: the grip on a golf club

data.chText: 头发
data.enText: for hair

data.chText: 影业工作
data.enText: job in the movies

data.chText: （拍摄电影时）摄影机和照明设备管理人员
data.enText: a person who prepares and moves the cameras, and sometimes the lighting equipment, when a film/movie is being made

data.chText: 包
data.enText: bag

data.chText: 旅行袋；手提包
data.enText: a large soft bag, used when travelling
come/get to grips with sth

data.chText: 开始理解并着手处理难题
data.enText: to begin to understand and deal with sth difficult

data.chText: 我慢慢开始掌握这种语言。
data.enText: I'm slowly getting to grips with the language.
get/take a grip (on yourself)

data.chText: 使（自己）镇定下来；控制住（自己的）情绪
data.enText: to improve your behaviour or control your emotions after being afraid, upset or angry

data.chText: 我一定要控制住自己的情绪，他坚定地对自己说。
data.enText: I have to take a grip on myself, he told himself firmly.

data.chText: 镇静点！
data.enText: Get a grip ! (= make an effort to control your emotions)
in the grip of sth

data.chText: 处于不快却无法制止的境遇；受制于某事
data.enText: experiencing sth unpleasant that cannot be stopped

data.chText: 陷入经济衰退的国家
data.enText: a country in the grip of recession
lose your grip (on sth)

data.chText: 失去（对…的）理解（或控制）；驾驭不住
data.enText: to become unable to understand or control a situation

data.chText: 有时我感到自己无能为力。
data.enText: Sometimes I feel I'm losing my grip.

data.chText: 紧握
data.enText: hold tightly

data.chText: 紧握；紧抓
data.enText: to hold sth tightly

data.chText: “请别走。”他紧紧抓住她的手臂说。
data.enText: ‘Please don't go,’ he said, gripping her arm.

data.chText: 她双手紧紧抓住栏杆。
data.enText: She gripped on to the railing with both hands.

data.chText: 使感兴趣；使激动
data.enText: interest/excite

data.chText: 使感兴趣；使激动；吸引住（某人）的注意
data.enText: to interest or excite sb; to hold sb's attention

data.chText: 这本书从头至尾扣人心弦。
data.enText: The book grips you from start to finish.

data.chText: 我完全被这故事吸引住了。
data.enText: I was totally gripped by the story.

data.chText: 具有强烈的影响力
data.enText: have powerful effect

data.chText: 对…产生强有力的影响

before.enText: of an emotion or a situation

data.enText: to have a powerful effect on sb/sth

data.chText: 我惊恐万状。
data.enText: I was gripped by a feeling of panic.

data.chText: 两年来恐怖主义一直笼罩着这个国家。
data.enText: Terrorism has gripped the country for the past two years.

data.chText: 不打滑；抓牢
data.enText: move/hold without slipping

data.chText: 抓牢
data.enText: to hold onto or to move over a surface without slipping

data.chText: 在公路上不打滑的车胎
data.enText: tyres that grip the road

data.text: hold ♦ hold on ♦ cling ♦ clutch ♦ grip ♦ grasp ♦ clasp ♦ hang on

data.chText: 以上各词均含抓住、抱住、托住、握住之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to have sb/sth in your hands, arms, etc.
hold

data.chText: 指抓住、抱住、托住、握住：
data.enText: to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.

data.chText: 她提着一只大箱子。
data.enText: She was holding a large box.

data.chText: 我把婴儿轻轻地抱在怀里。
data.enText: I held the baby gently in my arms.
hold on (to sb/sth)

data.chText: 指抓紧、不放开：
data.enText: to continue to hold sb/sth; to put your hand on sb/sth and not take your hand away

data.chText: 握紧，我让你松手时再松开。
data.enText: Hold on and don't let go until I say so.
cling

data.chText: 尤指用身体紧抱、紧握、抓紧：
data.enText: to hold on to sb/sth tightly, especially with your whole body

data.chText: 生还者紧紧抱住一块块漂浮在水面上的残骸。
data.enText: Survivors clung to pieces of floating debris.
clutch

data.chText: 尤指用手抓紧、紧握、抱紧、突然抓住：
data.enText: to hold sb/sth tightly, especially in your hand; to take hold of sth suddenly

data.chText: 她站在那里，手里仍然紧握着花束。
data.enText: She stood there, the flowers still clutched in her hand.

data.chText: 他感到自己滑了一下，便一把抓住一根树枝。
data.enText: He felt himself slipping and clutched at a branch.
grip

data.chText: 指用手紧握、紧抓：
data.enText: to hold on to sth very tightly with your hand

data.chText: 尽可能紧紧抓住绳子。
data.enText: Grip the rope as tightly as you can.
grasp

data.chText: 指抓紧、抓牢：
data.enText: to take hold of sth firmly

data.chText: 他热情地抓着我的手握了起来。
data.enText: He grasped my hand and shook it warmly.

data.chText: grasp的宾语通常为hand或wrist。
data.enText: The object of grasp is often sb's hand or wrist .
clasp

data.chText: 指紧握、攥紧、抱紧：
data.enText: ( formal ) to hold sb/sth tightly in your hand or in your arms

data.chText: 他们相互紧握着对方的手。
data.enText: They clasped hands (= held each other's hands) .

data.chText: 她把孩子紧紧地搂在怀里。
data.enText: She clasped the children in her arms.

data.chText: clasp的宾语通常为hand或另一个人。
data.enText: The object of clasp is often your hands , sb else's hand or another person.
hang on (to sth)

data.chText: 尤指为支撑自己或防止跌倒紧紧抓住某物：
data.enText: to hold on to sth very tightly, especially in order to support yourself or stop yourself from falling

data.chText: 抓紧，我们出发了！
data.enText: Hang on tight. We're off!
to hold/clutch/grip/clasp sth in your hand/hands
to hold/catch/clasp sb/sth in your arms
to grip/grasp sth with your hand/hands
to hold/clutch/grip/grasp/clasp/hang on to sth
to hold/cling/hang on
to hold/clutch/clasp sb/sth to you
to hold/hold on to/cling to/clutch/grip/grasp/clasp/hang on to sb/sth tight/tightly/firmly

word_means: 摄影机和照明设备管理人员

means: （拍摄电影时）摄影机和照明设备管理人员

ex.chText: 小偷抢了她的钱包逃跑了。
ex.enText: The thief snatched her purse and ran away.

ex.chText: 老鹰抓住一只鸽子飞走了。
ex.enText: The hawk snatched a pigeon and flew away.

ex.chText: 她走过去，好像要把信从他那里夺过来。
ex.enText: She walked over as if to snatch the letter from him.

synonyms.bx: 指突然地抢、夺、抓，强调动作迅速或具有暴力性质。

ex.chText: 那孩子紧紧抓住她的胳膊不放。
ex.enText: The child clutched her by the arm.

ex.chText: 他跳起来试图抓住那树枝，但没有成功。
ex.enText: He jumped up to clutch at the branch, but missed.

ex.chText: 抓救命稻草是无济于事的。
ex.enText: It is useless to clutch at straws.

synonyms.bx: 指因不想失去而紧紧地抓住某物，或因害怕、疼痛、危险等而突然抓住某人或某物。

ex.chText: 小偷猛地一把夺过她的钱包逃跑了。
ex.enText: The thief suddenly grabbed/snatched the purse from her and escaped.
Don't grab/snatch, there's plenty for everyone.
Quick, grab hold of that rope.

synonyms.bx: 指突然抓住某人或某物，强调动作粗野，作此义解时常可与snatch 换用；有时也指紧紧抓住某人或某物。

ex.chText: 抓住我的手，我把你拉过墙来。
ex.enText: Grasp my hand and I'll pull you over the wall.

synonyms.bx: 指紧紧地、牢牢地抓住某物。

ex.chText: 那个可怜的孩子紧紧地抓着母亲的手。
ex.enText: The poor child gripped his mother's hand.

ex.chText: 她使劲抓住栏杆，尽量不往下看。
ex.enText: She gripped the rail and tried not to look down.

synonyms.bx: 指用尽全力死死抓住某物，与 grasp 同义，但语气更强。

ex.chText: 他从书架上取了一本书。
ex.enText: He took a book from the shelf.
Someone took my cup by mistake.

ex.chText: 营房被攻占之后遭到了毁坏。
ex.enText: The camp was taken and destroyed.

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，指用手拿、取、抓或控制某物，不带任何感情色彩。

data.enText: come/get to grips with sth

data.chText: 开始理解并着手处理难题
data.enText: to begin to understand and deal with sth difficult

data.chText: 我慢慢开始掌握这种语言。
data.enText: I'm slowly getting to grips with the language.
get/take a grip (on yourself)

data.chText: 使（自己）镇定下来；控制住（自己的）情绪
data.enText: to improve your behaviour or control your emotions after being afraid, upset or angry

data.chText: 我一定要控制住自己的情绪，他坚定地对自己说。
data.enText: I have to take a grip on myself, he told himself firmly.

data.chText: 镇静点！
data.enText: Get a grip ! (= make an effort to control your emotions)
in the grip of sth

data.chText: 处于不快却无法制止的境遇；受制于某事
data.enText: experiencing sth unpleasant that cannot be stopped

data.chText: 陷入经济衰退的国家
data.enText: a country in the grip of recession
lose your grip (on sth)

data.chText: 失去（对…的）理解（或控制）；驾驭不住
data.enText: to become unable to understand or control a situation

data.chText: 有时我感到自己无能为力。
data.enText: Sometimes I feel I'm losing my grip.

example: he released his clasp on my arm
he has a strong grip for an old man
she kept a firm hold on the railing

tr: a portable rectangular container for carrying clothes
example: he carried his small bag onto the plane with him

tr: a flat wire hairpin whose prongs press tightly together
used to hold bobbed hair in place
example: in Britain they call a bobby pin a grip

tr: the appendage to an object that is designed to be held in order to use or move it
example: he grabbed the hammer by the handle
it was an old briefcase but it still had a good grip
a good grip on French history
they kept a firm grip on the two top priorities
he was in the grip of a powerful emotion
a terrible power had her in its grasp

tr: worker who moves the camera around while a film or television show is being made
the friction between a body and the surface on which it moves (as between an automobile tire and the road)
to grip or seize, as in a wrestling match
example: the two men grappled with each other for several minutes

tr: to render motionless, as with a fixed stare or by arousing terror or awe
example: The snake charmer fascinates the cobra

value.def: If you grip something, you take hold of it with your hand and continue to hold it firmly.
A grip is a firm, strong hold on something.

example.ex: His strong hand eased the bag from her grip.
example.tran: 他强有力的手迫使她松开了握紧袋子的双手。

value.def: Someone's grip on something is the power and control they have over it.

example.ex: The president maintains an iron grip on his country...
example.tran: 总统牢牢地控制着他的国家。

example.ex: Tony Blair last night tightened his grip on Labour mps with new powers to root out troublemakers.
example.tran: 昨晚，托尼·布莱尔利用新赋予的权力铲除了制造事端者，加强了对工党议员的控制。

value.def: If something grips you, it affects you very strongly.

example.ex: The entire community has been gripped by fear.

value.def: If you are gripped by something such as a story or a series of events, your attention is concentrated on it and held by it.

example.ex: The nation is gripped by the dramatic story.
example.tran: 举国上下都为那个戏剧性的故事牵动着。

example.ex: The film turned out to be a gripping thriller.
example.tran: 那部电影原来是部扣人心弦的惊悚片。

value.def: If things such as shoes or car tyres have grip, they do not slip.

example.ex: ...a new way of reinforcing rubber which gives car tyres better grip.
example.tran: 加固橡胶以增强车胎抓地力的新方法

value.def: A grip is a bag that is smaller than a suitcase, and that you use when you are travelling.
If you get to grips with a problem or if you come to grips with it, you consider it seriously, and start taking action to deal with it.

example.ex: The government's first task is to get to grips with the economy.
example.tran: 政府的首要任务是处理好经济问题。

value.def: If you get a grip on yourself, you make an effort to control or improve your behaviour or work.
value.tran: （使自己）镇定下来；控制住（自己）

value.def: If a person, group, or place is in the grip of something, they are being severely affected by it.

example.ex: Britain is still in the grip of recession.
example.tran: 英国依然没有摆脱经济衰退。

example.ex: ...a region in the grip of severe drought.
example.tran: 受大旱严重影响的地区

value.def: If you lose your grip, you become less efficient and less confident, and less able to deal with things.
value.tran: 效率降低；失去信心；驾驭不住

value.def: If you say that someone has a grip on reality, you mean they recognize the true situation and do not have mistaken ideas about it.

example.ex: Shakur loses his fragile grip on reality and starts blasting away at friends and foe alike.
example.tran: 沙库尔丧失了对形势仅存的一点判断，无论对敌对友都开始大加挞伐。
